info.title: IGDB API
info.description:
This OpenAPI documentation and schema project IS IN BETA and maintained by [s-crypt.](https://github.com/s-crypt)

The source code and more information is [available in the GitHub repository](https://github.com/s-crypt/IGDB-OpenAPI)

Issues and pull requests are welcome! Please report any bugs or discrepancies you come across!

servers.description: The main base URL for the IGDB API

post.summary: Age Rating according to various rating organizations
Official artworks (resolution and aspect ratio may vary)
Video game companies. Both publishers & developers
The logos of developers and publishers
Gaming event like GamesCom, Tokyo Game Show, PAX or GSL
Urls related to the event like twitter, facebook and youtube
A list of video game franchises such as Star Wars.
Video game engines such as unreal engine.
Details about game editions and versions.
Features and descriptions of what makes each version/edition different from the main game
The bool/text value of the feature
A video associated with a game
Keywords are words or phrases that get tagged to a game such as “world war 2” or “steampunk”.
Languages that are used in the Language Support endpoint.
Language Support Types contains the identifiers for the support types that Language Support uses.
Data about the supported multiplayer types
Games can be played with different languages for voice acting, subtitles, or the interface language.
Social networks related to the event like twitter, facebook and youtube
A collection of closely related platforms
The hardware used to run the game or game delivery network
A handy endpoint that extends platform release dates. Used to dig deeper into release dates, platforms and versions.
The main website for the platform
Player perspectives describe the view/perspective of the player in a video game.
A handy endpoint that extends game release dates. Used to dig deeper into release dates, platforms and versions.
An endpoint to provide definition of all of the current release date statuses.
A website url, usually associated with a game

example.Tip 1: Ensure you are sending Authorization and Client-ID as headers.
example.Tip 2: Ensure Authorization value starts with 'Bearer ', including the space
example.Tip 3: Ensure Authorization value ends with the App Access Token you generated, NOT your Client Secret.

example.title: Forbidden
example.details: You typed in 2500 but your maximum is 500

content_descriptions.description: Array of Age Rating Content Description IDs

rating_cover_url.description: The url for the image of an age rating

synopsis.description: A free text motivating a rating

The organization that has issued a specific rating  
1: ESRB  
2: PEGI  
3: CERO

6: CLASS_IND  
7: ACB

aggregated_rating.description: Rating based on external critic scores

collection.description: DEPRRICATED - Use collections field. Reference ID for collection

follows.description: DEPRECATED- TO BE REMOVED. The number of people following a game

first_release_date.description: The first release date for this game

franchises.description: Other franchises the game belongs to

game_engines.description: The game engine used in this game

game_localizations.description: Supported game localizations for this game. A region can have at most one game localization for a given game

hypes.description: Number of follows a game gets before release

parent_game.description: If a DLC, expansion or part of a bundle, this is the main game or bundle

storyline.description: A short description of a games story

tags.description: Related entities in the IGDB API

total_rating.description: Average rating based on both IGDB user and external critic scores

total_rating_count.description: Total number of user and external critic scores

url.description: The website address (URL) of the item

version_parent.description: If a version, this is the main game

version_title.description: Title of this version (i.e Gold edition)

A game's category/catagories

2: expansion

4: standalone_expansion  
5: mod  
6: episode  
7: season  
8: remake  
9: remaster  
10: expanded_game  
11: port  
12: fork  
13: pack  
14: update

A game's operational status  
0: released  
2: alpha  
3: beta  
4: early_access  
5: offline  
6: cancelled  
7: rumored  
8: delisted

MultiplayerMode.description: Data about the supported multiplayer types

camapigncoop.description: True if the game supports campaign coop

dropin.description: True if the game supports drop in/out multiplayer

lancoop.description: True if the game supports LAN coop

offlinecoop.description: True if the game supports offline coop

offliencoopmax.description: Maximum number of offline players in offline coop

offlinemax.description: Maximum number of players in offline multiplayer

onlinecoop.description: True if the game supports online coop

onlinecoopmax.description: Maximum number of online players in online coop

onlinemax.description: Maximum number of online players in online coop

splitscreen.description: True if the game supports, split screen, offline multiplayer

splitscreenonline.description: True if the game supports split screen, online multiplayer

LanguageSupport.description: Games can be played with different languages for voice acting, subtitles, or the interface language.
